29328.name: Credit
29328.desc: This currency, used by the Interastral Peace Corporation to settle accounts with its customers, is now widely accepted as the hard currency for space travel.
29328.lore: "People run around fighting and trading for numbers in a terminal, but the truly precious cannot be bought."

125435.name: Tracks of Destiny
125435.lore: Your victory is secured by countless failures, and the small steps you have taken led you to the turning point of fate.

409960.name: Traveler's Guide
409960.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>20,000</nobr> Character EXP.
409960.lore:
Required reading for world exploration. Press the "Read" button to tune in to an attractive voice in a language you understand, telling you about the legendary encounters of renowned adventurers across different worlds as well as the precious wisdom and knowledge that they have gathered.

"All-new series of the Traveler's Guide, The Chef's Manual to Galactic Cuisine, is now available for purchase."
"For submissions, please connect to synesthesia beacon ERD-23θ to contact an Intelligentsia Guild representative. Method of payment can be arranged to your convenience."

409961.name: Adventure Log
409961.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>5000</nobr> Character EXP.
409961.lore:
A neatly organized collection of educational adventure notes containing countless illustrations and texts entailing adventures from beginning to end, as well as valuable information and survival-related techniques.

"Why not just digitize it and save it on a photolith disk? That'd be much more convenient."
"Advanced technology is far more fragile than you'd think when faced with stellar storms and neuron flow eruptions. Besides, I'm sure the author of this book wanted people to read it in the simplest of ways."

409962.name: Travel Encounters
409962.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>1000</nobr> Character EXP.
409962.lore:
A travel diary with messy handwriting and random content. It's not of much use to you.

"Dan Heng, hurry up and finish reading it so you can throw it away."

549407.name: Silvermane Badge
549407.desc: Pin badge worn by soldiers of the Silvermane Guards. Crude material used for enhancement.
549407.lore:
It is full of scratches from the erosion of wind and snow.

"In ancient times, there was only one way Silvermane Guards could retire: death."

633348.name: Silvermane Insignia
633348.desc: Military rank insignia worn by captains of the Silvermane Guard. Normal material used for enhancement.
633348.lore:
Maybe it's a proof of heroics that you can brag about to your family. Maybe it's a lucky charm that protects you from a bullet.

"Times have changed."
comeFrom: Everwinter Shadewalker and Incineration Shadewalker at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher
Silvermane Guards and vagrants at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher

635670.name: Harmonic Tune
635670.desc: A compact music box made by an unknown person. Used to level up Traces slightly for Harmony characters.
635670.lore:
It plays a relaxing and joyful tune.
Even through the simplistic tune, anyone with the slightest understanding of music can tell the mastery of the composer of the piece.

"Grab the hands of your Family and let us dance!"

717289.name: Silvermane Medal
717289.desc: Medal of honor worn by soldiers of the Silvermane Guards with gallant and meritorious service. Advanced material used for enhancement.
717289.lore:
A proof of honor awarded to those that fought against Fragmentum creatures, Underworlders, and sudden disasters.
It is not usually pinned onto the recipient's chest, but rather placed onto his coffin.

"Remember, young Gepard. It is not a toy: it is the destiny and blood of the Landau family."
comeFrom: Everwinter Shadewalker and Incineration Shadewalker at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher
Silvermane Guards and vagrants at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher

836256.name: Stellaris Symphony
836256.desc: A music box with complex structures made by an unknown person. Used to level up Traces significantly for Harmony characters.
836256.lore:
It plays a powerful cosmic symphony.

"Some astronomers believe that the revolutions of the heavenly spheres work the same as complex mechanical structures. The crystal clear and pleasant notes emitted during the movements of the stars are known as the 'Harmony of the Heavenly Spheres.'"

920197.name: Ancestral Hymn
920197.desc: A music box made by an unknown person. Used to level up Traces moderately for Harmony characters.
920197.lore:
It plays a hymn sung by a small band.
It is impossible to find out to whom the lyric of the hymn sends its praise.

"Penury, trial of the Great One! Wealth, grace of the Great One!"

983278.name: Endotherm Chitin
983278.desc: Hot, translucent substance almost like fire in the solid state. Can be used for the Ascension of Fire characters.
983278.lore:
Strange chitin peeled off from an interdimensional creature. Although not piping hot anymore, it still radiates warmth.

"It's too cold outside. But with this gemstone on you, you'll be able to travel far and wide, even to search for cities with humans left..."

985668.name: Destroyer's Final Road
985668.lore:
The Leviathan's heart has stopped beating, but its mind lives on despite being trapped in a case. As long as the lid is closed, its mind is simultaneously both alive and dead, driving the engine of destruction.

"Doomsday Beast, a blight made in the Warforge using what's left of a Leviathan and the weeping bones of thousands of the dead. It longs for the destruction of the universe and itself."

ranks.name: Star Sings Sans Verses or Vocals
ranks.descHash: When using Skill, deals DMG for 1 extra time to a random enemy.

ranks.name: Moon Speaks in Wax and Wane
ranks.descHash: After using her Ultimate, Asta's Charging stacks will not be reduced in the next turn.

ranks.name: Meteor Showers for Wish and Want
ranks.descHash:
Skill Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Talent Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.

ranks.name: Aurora Basks in Beauty and Bliss
ranks.descHash: Asta's Energy Regeneration Rate increases by <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr> when she has <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> or more Charging stacks.

ranks.name: Nebula Secludes in Runes and Riddles
ranks.descHash:
Ultimate Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Basic ATK Lv. +1, up to a maximum of Lv. 10.

ranks.name: Cosmos Dreams in Calm and Comfort
ranks.descHash: Charging stack(s) lost in each turn is reduced by <nobr>#1[i]</nobr>.

skills.descHash: Deals Fire DMG equal to #1[i]% of Asta's ATK to a single enemy.
skills.name: Spectrum Beam

skills.descHash: Deals Fire DMG equal to #1[i]% of Asta's ATK to a single enemy and further deals DMG for 4 extra times, with each time dealing Fire DMG equal to #1[i]% of Asta's ATK to a random enemy.
skills.name: Meteor Storm

skills.descHash: Increases SPD of all allies by #1[i] for #2[i] turn(s).
skills.name: Astral Blessing

skills.descHash:
Gains 1 stack of Charging for every different enemy hit by Asta plus an extra stack if the enemy hit has Fire Weakness.
For every stack of Charging Asta has, all allies' ATK increases by #1[f1]%, up to #2[i] time(s).
Starting from her second turn, Asta's Charging stack count is reduced by #3[i] at the beginning of every turn.
skills.name: Astrometry

skills.descHash: Attack an enemy, and when the battle starts, reduce their Toughness of the corresponding Type.
skills.name: Attack

skills.descHash: Immediately attacks the enemy. After entering battle, deals Fire DMG equal to #1[i]% of Asta's ATK to all enemies.
skills.name: Miracle Flash

embedBonusSkill.descHash:
Asta's Basic ATK has a #1[i]% base chance to Burn an enemy target for #2[i] turn(s).
Burned enemies take Fire DoT equal to #3[i]% of DMG dealt by Asta's Basic ATK at the start of each turn.
embedBonusSkill.name: Sparks

embedBonusSkill.descHash: When Asta is on the field, all allies' Fire DMG increases by #1[i]%.
embedBonusSkill.name: Ignite

embedBonusSkill.descHash: Asta's DEF increases by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> for every current Charging stack she possesses.
embedBonusSkill.name: Constellation

voiceItems.title: First Meeting
voiceItems.text: Hi, Trailblazer! The name's Asta, I'm the lead researcher on Herta Space Station. I'll be sure to let you know if I need your help... Don't worry, I think you'll be hearing from me.

voiceItems.title: Greeting
voiceItems.text: *yawn* You're here! The observation matrix we adjusted should have some results for us now. Free to take a look?

voiceItems.title: Parting
voiceItems.text: Is that the time? Time flies when you're working hard.

voiceItems.title: About Self: Family
voiceItems.text: *sigh* Even if I never kept in touch with any of my relatives, they would find their way over here.

voiceItems.title: About Self: Work
voiceItems.text: You heard right! If I don't work hard, I'll have to go back and inherit the family fortune... *sigh*

voiceItems.title: Chat: Astronomy Thesis
voiceItems.text: ...I haven't written a single word yet... But it won't take long once I get started!

voiceItems.title: Chat: Space Station
voiceItems.text: "The space station is merely Herta's toy box." That's by no means an inaccurate statement. But this is Herta we're talking about — her toys are pretty dangerous~

voiceItems.title: Hobbies
voiceItems.text: Continuously channeling funds into constructing the space station, improving employee benefits, creating a positive feedback loop... Ahem, as well as satisfying the lead researcher's — that is to say my — indispensable shopping needs.

voiceItems.title: Annoyances
voiceItems.text: If only Madam Herta could pay a visit to the space station more often — the researchers are clearly her followers.

voiceItems.title: Something to Share
voiceItems.text: When I first got to the space station, the researchers had prepared a room for me. I—I was really grateful, but it was far away from everyone else. That was a bit disheartening.

voiceItems.title: Knowledge
voiceItems.text: Even the monitoring room is being monitored.

voiceItems.title: About Arlan
voiceItems.text: Arlan's always saying stuff like, "all of you must heed Lead Researcher Asta's judgment!" Then when I remind him that that includes him, he says, "don't worry, I have my own judgment."

voiceItems.title: About Herta
voiceItems.text: If there's anyone who thinks they can be as headstrong as Madam Herta, I'd recommend they consider whether or not they possess her intelligence first.

voiceItems.title: Battle Begins: Weakness Break
voiceItems.text: Hm. Scared yet?

voiceItems.title: Battle Begins: Danger Alert
voiceItems.text: Time to get vigilant.

voiceItems.title: Turn Begins 1
voiceItems.text: A guest with no manners, huh?

voiceItems.title: Turn Begins 2
voiceItems.text: I don't remember inviting you.

voiceItems.title: Turn Idling
voiceItems.text: Guess what I'm about to do~

voiceItems.title: Basic ATK
voiceItems.text: Look out~

voiceItems.title: Skill 1
voiceItems.text: Who's the lucky one today?

voiceItems.title: Skill 2
voiceItems.text: A gift from the stars~

voiceItems.title: Hit by Light Attack
voiceItems.text: Ow ow ow...

voiceItems.title: Hit by Heavy Attack
voiceItems.text: No, don't...

voiceItems.title: Ultimate: Activate
voiceItems.text: Everything is ordained by the stars.

voiceItems.title: Ultimate: Unleash
voiceItems.text: Oh profound secrets of the stars, give these Trailblazers your blessing!

voiceItems.title: Downed
voiceItems.text: But I want... to know more...

voiceItems.title: Return to Battle
voiceItems.text: That didn't count, let's go again!

voiceItems.title: Health Recovery
voiceItems.text: Saving me won't earn you any favors.

voiceItems.title: Technique
voiceItems.text: Found your weakness~

voiceItems.title: Battle Won
voiceItems.text: The stars will always remember us.

voiceItems.title: Treasure Opening
voiceItems.text: Do I have this already?

voiceItems.title: Successful Puzzle-Solving
voiceItems.text: Progress~

voiceItems.title: Enemy Target Found
voiceItems.text: Might as well beat it up before it attacks me.

voiceItems.title: Returning to Town
voiceItems.text: Can you see the stars from here too?

storyItems.title: Character Details
storyItems.text:
A fiercely inquisitive and energetic young girl. She is the Lead Researcher of the space station Herta.
Whether it is managing opinionated staff, or courteously but firmly responding to the Intelligentsia Guild's devious demands, Asta handles it all effortlessly.
After all... commanding a space station is much easier than taking over the family business!

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part I
storyItems.text:
Back when she was still a child but was already picking out her own telescopes, Asta would always hear the faint murmurings of elders praising her. She was quite proud of this, because she could discern the quality of a telescope's primary mirror and autoguider with a mere glance.

It wasn't until she drew within earshot one day that she learned they were actually tutting and tsking at her — how could such a little girl manage to pick out such expensive items?

Personal hobbies don't exist in the eyes of these people. All they chose to see is a pampered little princess.

"You like stars? Oh, I get it. You're a little girl. You all like sparkly things."
"Yes... I'm researching protostars at the moment. I hope to name the stars I discover after myself... Just like those famous astronomers of old."
"Is that all? Shall we name this planet after you for your next birthday? How about two planets? Those are actually quite cheap."
"..."
"Hey, where are you going, Asta? Asta!!!"

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part II
storyItems.text:
She knows that it doesn't matter whether she and her mother are reliable volunteers. People just want to see them here. That's all.

After apportioning the food, the people disperse one by one, leaving behind a little boy. His right hand is wounded, and his eyes are like that of a wolf as he stares at her in a way she doesn't like.

"Are you going to ask me to borrow money?"
"I don't want any money. I have to pay back the cost of this meal, but I don't have any money on me."

Occasionally, "friends" she never recognizes would come and ask if they could borrow money from Asta. However, it's the first time she actually heard someone offer to pay her back. Her eyes widen in surprise. Listening in, her mother can't help but laugh.

"You're still a kid. What kind of work can you do?"
"Fight."
"That's not a good job. How about this — I'll give you a job."

To this day, in Asta's heart, the bill for Arlan's meal was settled the moment he said that he'd pay her back.

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part III
storyItems.text:
"The stars follow their own orbits, but what about humans... Can we humans ever hope to control our own destiny?"

A wealthy family background grants Asta the power to explore the stars, but also become her personal shackles.

As she grows older, Asta's vow to become an astronomer was viewed as increasingly radical by her family. She begins to lose count of how many times she'd argue during family meetings about this very thing.

Until one day, after a family meeting, a puppet girl walks in, And one of the family members who were so domineering a moment ago suddenly changes into a yes-man.

"That's the girl."
"But she'd..."
"No buts. I didn't come all this way to listen to your garbage academic reports. I'd rather listen to this girl debate with you."
"..."
"I want to see her on the space station within three days."

And with that, the puppet girl walks straight out without looking back.

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part IV
storyItems.text:
After becoming the Lead Researcher of the Herta space station, Asta's life is now busier than ever before. She has to manage the researchers and their differing opinions, reply to the numerous correspondence meant for Herta, constantly negotiate with the IPC, and procure equipment from various different sources... But at the same time, she's experiencing the greatest freedom she'd ever known...

"Deploy the Nyul Iman telescope in the second equipment bay. Set it to 100× astronomical units, and begin observation of the pre-stellar core in front of us."
"Pay close attention to particle density. If you discover any super-dense structures, commence recording of the protostar fragmentation process at once."

In her spare time, Asta would sometimes consider how Madam Herta never seems to come around anymore after Asta arrived at the space station. She even made inquiries, but was told, "If there's no interesting new stuff, I won't bother coming in."

"...I'd rather listen to this girl debate with you."

She thought back to the words Herta had casually told her family on that day long age.

The Herta of her memories seems to stand out amongst resplendent starlight, giving her the power to control the starry sky — and her own destiny.

name: Asta
descHash: The lead researcher of Herta Space Station and a lady from a renowned family. She's an astronomer overflowing with curiosity, and excels at managing the disparate staff of the space station.
